t: Isaiah 59
Separated from God
Behold,*pn the Lord’s*s hand is not shortened, That*ld it cannot save; Nor*ld His ear heavy, That*ld it cannot hear.
But*ld your iniquities have separated you from your God; And*ld your sins have hidden His*i face from you, So*ld that He will not hear.
For*ld your hands are defiled with blood, And*ld your fingers with iniquity; Your*ld lips have spoken lies, Your*ld tongue has muttered perversity.
No*ln one calls for justice, Nor*ld does any*i plead for truth. They*ld trust in empty words and speak lies; They*ld conceive evil and bring forth iniquity.
They*ld hatch vipers’ eggs and weave the spider’s web; He*ld who eats of their eggs dies, And*ld from*i that which is crushed a viper breaks out.
Their*ln webs will not become garments, Nor*ld will they cover themselves with their works; Their*ld works are*i works of iniquity, And*ld the act of violence is*i in their hands.
Their*ld feet run to evil, And*ld they make haste to shed innocent blood; Their*ld thoughts are*i thoughts of iniquity; Wasting*ld and destruction are*i in their paths.
The*ld way of peace they have not known, And*ld there*i is*i no justice in their ways; They*ld have made themselves crooked paths; Whoever*ld takes that way shall not know peace.
Sin Confessed
Therefore*pn justice is far from us, Nor*ld does righteousness overtake us; We*ld look for light, but there is darkness! For*ld brightness, but*i we walk in blackness!
We*ld grope for the wall like the blind, And*ld we grope as if we*i had*i no eyes; We*ld stumble at noonday as at twilight; We*ild are*i as dead men*i in desolate places.
We*ld all growl like bears, And*ld moan sadly like doves; We*ld look for justice, but there*i is*i none; For*ld salvation, but*i it is far from us.
For*ld our transgressions are multiplied before You, And*ld our sins testify against us; For*ld our transgressions are*i with us, And*ld as*i for*i our iniquities, we know them:
In*ld transgressing and lying against the Lord,*s And*ld departing from our God, Speaking*ld oppression and revolt, Conceiving*ld and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
Justice*ld is turned back, And*ld righteousness stands afar off; For*ld truth is fallen in the street, And*ld equity cannot enter.
So*ld truth fails, And*ld he who*i departs from evil makes himself a prey.
The Redeemer of Zion
Then*pn the Lord*s saw it,*i and it displeased Him That*ld there*i was*i no justice.
He*ln saw that there*i was*i no man, And*ld wondered that there*i was*i no intercessor; Therefore*ld His own arm brought salvation for Him; And*ld His own righteousness, it sustained Him.
For*ld He put on righteousness as a breastplate, And*ld a helmet of salvation on His head; He*ld put on the garments of vengeance for clothing, And*ld was clad with zeal as a cloak.
According*ld to their*i deeds, accordingly He will repay, Fury*ld to His adversaries, Recompense*ld to His enemies; The*ld coastlands He will fully repay.

So*ld shall they fear The*ld name of the Lord*s from the west, And*ld His glory from the rising of the sun; When*ld the enemy comes in like a flood, The*ld Spirit of the Lord*s will lift up a standard against him.
“The*ln Redeemer will come to Zion, And*ld to those who turn from transgression in Jacob,” Says*ld the Lord.*s

“As*p for Me,” says the Lord,*s “this is*i My covenant with them: My Spirit who is*i upon you, and My words which I have put in your mouth, shall not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouth of your descendants, nor from the mouth of your descendants’ descendants,” says the Lord,*s “from this time and forevermore.”
